questions.question: If <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>31</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Solve <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>31</mn></math>: subtract 7 to get <math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn></math>, then divide by 4 to get <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Then <math><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>48</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>43</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Solve for the variable first, then substitute into the expression. Avoid solving the expression directly unless it simplifies nicely.

questions.question: If <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Solve <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>: add 12 to get <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>, then divide by 5 to get <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: After finding x, compute the required expression carefully. Check for simple arithmetic errors.

questions.question: Which equation has the same solution as <math><mn>9</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Divide both sides of the original equation by 9: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>27</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac></math> → <math><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find an equivalent equation, perform the same operation on both sides (like division) rather than distributing incorrectly.

questions.question: If <math><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>24</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>p</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Subtract 24: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>. Divide by 3: <math><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Isolate the variable step by step: first add/subtract constants, then multiply/divide coefficients.

questions.question: If <math><mn>8</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute: <math><mn>8</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>21</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></math> → <math><mn>8</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>23</mn></math>. Subtract <math><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></math>: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>32</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>23</mn></math>. Add 32: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>55</mn></math>. Divide by 5: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving equations with variables on both sides, collect like terms carefully and check your arithmetic.

questions.question: A gym membership costs $45 per month plus a one-time enrollment fee of $75. If a member pays a total of $555 after x months, which equation represents this situation?
questions.explanation: The total cost = monthly cost × months + one-time fee: <math><mn>45</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>75</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>555</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Identify the fixed cost (one-time) and the variable cost (per month) when setting up linear equations for real-world contexts.

questions.question: If <math><mn>7</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>t</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute: <math><mn>14</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Subtract <math><mn>12</mn><mi>t</mi></math>: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Add 35: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>38</mn></math>. Divide by 2: <math><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>19</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When equations have parentheses, distribute carefully before combining like terms.

questions.question: If <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Multiply both sides by 5: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn></math>. Subtract 12: <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>33</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To clear fractions, multiply both sides by the denominator.

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 50 inches. If the length is 3 inches more than twice the width, what is the width in inches?
questions.explanation: Let width = <math><mi>w</mi></math>. Length = <math><mn>2</mn><mi>w</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Perimeter: <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>w</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>w</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math> → <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>w</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math> → <math><mn>6</mn><mi>w</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math> → <math><mn>6</mn><mi>w</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>44</mn></math> → <math><mi>w</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>44</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>22</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>≈</mo><mn>7.33</mn></math>. Closest integer is 7.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Define variables clearly, write expressions for length, then set up the perimeter equation. Solve step by step.

questions.question: If <math><mn>6</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math> → <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math> → <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Look for common factors (like x+4) to simplify before solving.

questions.question: For what value of <math><mi>c</mi></math> does the equation <math><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>23</mn></math> have infinitely many solutions?
questions.explanation: Simplify left: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>23</mn></math>. For infinitely many solutions (an identity), the expressions must be identical. Compare coefficients of x: both are 5x, so they match. Compare constants: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>23</mn></math>. Solve: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>25</mn></math> → <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. So answer is D.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For infinitely many solutions, both sides of the equation must simplify to the same expression (identical coefficients and constants).

questions.question: If <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math> has infinitely many solutions, and <math><mi>a</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is <math><mi>a</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Simplify left side: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>38</mn></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9.5</mn></math>. So equation is: <math><mn>0.5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9.5</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. For infinitely many solutions (identity), coefficients of x must match: <math><mn>0.5</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi></math>. Constants must match: <math><mn>9.5</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>0.5</mn></math>. So <math><mn>9.5</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>0.5</mn></math> → <math><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></mfrac></math> → <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For infinitely many solutions, set coefficients of x equal and constant terms equal after simplifying both sides.

questions.question: If <math><mn>8</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math> → <math><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math> → <math><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Factor out common expressions to simplify equations quickly.

questions.question: How many solutions does <math><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></math> have?
questions.explanation: Distribute: <math><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. Subtract <math><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi></math>: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></math>, which is false. Therefore, no solution (zero solutions).
questions.score_improvement_tip: When variables cancel out and you're left with a false statement, the equation has no solution.

questions.question: If <math><mn>0.3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>t</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Distribute right: <math><mn>0.6</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn></math>. Equation: <math><mn>0.3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn></math>. Subtract <math><mn>0.6</mn><mi>t</mi></math>: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn></math>. Add 1.2: <math><mo>−</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.9</mn></math>. Divide by -0.3: <math><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Work carefully with decimals; consider multiplying through by 10 to eliminate them.

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to <math><mn>9</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: The expression is a perfect square trinomial: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><msup><mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Recognize perfect square trinomials: a² - 2ab + b² = (a - b)².

questions.question: If <math><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, what is the positive value of <math><mi>n</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Factor: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. So <math><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> or <math><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. The positive value is 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For quadratic equations, factor out common terms first before applying the zero-product property.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrowhead' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='7' refX='0' refY='3.5' orient='auto'><polygon points='0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7' fill='black'/></marker></defs><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><path d='M 50 70 L 50 250 L 298 250 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='148' y2='142' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><polyline points='50 230 70 230 70 250' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1.5'/><path d='M 90 250 A 40 40 0 0 0 77 220' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><path d='M 73 224 A 35 35 0 0 0 50 215' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='35' y='70' font-family='serif' font-size='18' font-weight='bold'>A</text><text x='308' y='260' font-family='serif' font-size='18' font-weight='bold'>B</text><text x='30' y='270' font-family='serif' font-size='18' font-weight='bold'>C</text><text x='155' y='135' font-family='serif' font-size='18' font-weight='bold'>D</text><text x='60' y='200' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='16'>x°</text><text x='95' y='245' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='16'>48°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A right-angled triangle ABC is shown with the right angle at vertex C (bottom-left). The triangle has a vertical leg AC and a horizontal leg CB. A line segment CD is drawn from the right angle C to point D on the hypotenuse AB. This segment divides the right angle into two adjacent angles: angle DCB (labeled 48°) formed with the horizontal leg, and angle ACD (labeled x°) formed with the vertical leg.
questions.question: In right triangle ABC with right angle at C, segment CD divides angle ACB into two angles. If angle ACD measures x°, angle DCB measures 48°, and angle CAB measures 54°, what is the value of x?
questions.explanation:
Since angle C is a right angle (90°), the sum of the adjacent angles making up angle C must equal 90°. We are given that angle DCB is 48° and angle ACD is x°.
Therefore, the equation is:
x+48=90
Solving for x:
x=90-48=42
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a line divides a right angle, the two resulting angles are complementary, meaning they add up to 90 degrees.

questions.question: A store increases the price of an item by 25%. After a month, the price is decreased by 20%. The final price is $60. What was the original price?
questions.explanation: Let original price = P. After 25% increase: 1.25P. After 20% decrease: 0.80 × 1.25P = 1.00P = P. So the final price equals the original price. Given final price is $60, the original price is $60.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For successive percent changes, multiply by (1 + increase) and (1 - decrease). They may cancel out.

questions.question: If <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math>, what is the minimum value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: The function is quadratic with a=1>0, so it has a minimum at vertex. Vertex x-coordinate: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a quadratic f(x)=ax²+bx+c, the vertex x-coordinate is -b/(2a). Plug that x into f to find min/max.
